meanings.definition: To form or make into a ball.
meanings.sent1: She balled up the paper and threw it in the trash.
meanings.sent2: The children balled the clay to create small sculptures.
meanings.sent3: He balled the dough into a perfect circle, like a pizza chef.
meanings.sent4: The snow balled as it rolled down the hill, getting bigger and bigger.
meanings.sent5: The magician balled up a piece of paper and made it disappear in his hand.

meanings.definition: To gather into a ball shape.
meanings.sent1: The cat balled itself up into a cozy furry circle on the couch.
meanings.sent2: She balled the yarn before starting to knit a scarf.
meanings.sent3: The kids balled up their socks and had a playful sock fight.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds balled together ominously in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The laundry balled up in the corner until it was time to fold.

meanings.sent1: The snow balled as the kids rolled it into a snowman.
meanings.sent2: The wet sand balled in his hands as he tried to build a sandcastle.
meanings.sent3: The dough balled up nicely as she kneaded it for the bread.
meanings.sent4: The leaves balled together in the wind, forming a natural barrier.
meanings.sent5: The clay balled up easily, ready to be shaped into pottery.
